name: Incube
description: Incube is a Space as a Service offering by IncuBus Ventures which offers solutions for anyone with large real estate assets to create smart, flexible and energy-efficient spaces that promote strong innovation communities. Incube is reimaging the future of space and how we use it.

team.name: Rishi Chowdhury
team.bioHtml: Co founder @Momentum London , @Incube & @OfficialYHP. Previously online marketing manager @Huddle.

team.name: George Johnston
team.bioHtml: Accelerating sustainable innovation @Tech City Ventures • Founder @Nitrous @TechDotX @Momentum London @Incube @swiftscale • Worked at @Huddle

team.name: Luis Hidalgo
team.bioHtml: Creative mind, serial entrepreneur, analysis freak and, last but not least, bicycle passionate, currently working as a Investor Relations for  Startupbootcamp.

jobs.title: Business Development Intern
jobs.description:
IncuBus London

We support companies host unique pop up experiences in our renovated Double Decker bus. Whether at a conference or touring Europe the bus draws attention and allows our clients to showcase their business and flourish. 

We also develop corporate innovation labs with a turnkey solution encompassing location scouting, design, fit out, community building and technology integration. 

________________________________________________________


Role

We're looking for a proactive individual who is comfortable engaging with everyone from startups through to corporates and government departments to build relations and pipeline of leads for the bus pop-ups and space as a service product.

________________________________________________________


Key Responsibilities

- Targetted outreach - identify the ideal customer personas, find and engage with them 

- Identify new and most effective channels for getting in front of the right audience and building out the pipeline

- Attending targetted events and representing the company and applicable product

- Market research to ensure we understand how the market is shifting and can discover new opportunities

and more...

________________________________________________________


Desired Skills & Experience

- Fluent in written and oral English 

- Highly organised

- Motivated by targets

- Goal orientated

- Perfectionist

- Pro-active

- Commercially minded 
________________________________________________________


Remuneration

- Full-time Internship with potential for a full-time salaried position

- The initial contract is expenses and a generous commission

- There will be quarterly reviews to ensure progress and regular opportunities to increase responsibilities and contract 

________________________________________________________


Working Environment

We're a small but fast moving and ambitious team - we like a challenge and an opportunity to show it can be done. We strive for the highest quality in everything we do and ensure that everyone we interact with has a great experience. 

Monthly team drinks and regular socials. Working in a co-working space and in a private office with our sister companies so always someone in the office. Wednesday cake day and Friday beers in the co-working space. Startup buzz and entrepreneurial environment

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.description:
We are looking for an outstanding Project Manager with experience in the commercial real estate industry, to drive forward the vision for Incube. 

Your main responsibilities will be to plan, coordinate, and supervise the construction of commercial projects from start to finish, liaising with internal and external teams, and clients.  

= About us =

Incube is a platform that cultivates the most productive environments for innovation to flourish. Through design and technology, Incube transforms spaces into thriving interactive and engaging communities. 

Our platform enables spaces to take on a new life inspiring, improving and empowering members and visitors. We work with companies to discover, design, fit out and manage spaces, build thriving communities and create healthy productive working environments.  

= Responsibilities =

+ Management of project schedule, budget and aspects that may hinder quality of project delivery 
+ Primary contact for all external stakeholders in project 
+ Ensuring the team is adequately resourced to meet project needs
+ Management of invoicing and cash flow during project 
+ Implementation of necessary processes with project team and external parties 
+ Inspiring the project team to meet targets through effective leadership

= Requirements =

Essential
+ Construction industry expertise (essential)
+ A meticulous attention to detail
+ Extraordinarily organised
+ A self-starter, hungry to challenge themselves and to achieve success
+ Outstanding interpersonal and communicative skills 
+ Willingness to travel and oversee project progress on regular basis

Desirable
+ Passionate about technology and creating incredible experiences
+ Ability to work across teams and functions to achieve success
+ Ability to inspire others 
+ Perfectionist 

We have flexible hours and a fantastic location, work out of an awesome coworking space in Shoreditch, operate within a great network and have big growth plans.

If you are interested in applying for this role, explain in no more than 140 characters why you're the ideal candidate.

jobs.title: Office Manager - Incube - Innovation Lab
jobs.description:
ABOUT

Incube is a platform that cultivates the most productive environments for innovation to flourish. Through design and technology, Incube transforms spaces into thriving interactive and engaging communities. 

Our platform enables spaces to take on a new life inspiring, improving and empowering members and visitors. We work with companies to discover, design, fit out and manage spaces, build thriving communities and create healthy productive working environments.  


ROLE

Support in running one of the most advanced co-creation spaces in the world. The corporate-backed innovation space is designed to foster a creative collaborative community in the mobility and smart city arena.

We’re looking for an organised, enthusiastic, approachable individual to ensure the office runs smoothly and deal with any issues that may arise quickly and efficiently. You will be the first port of call to tenants. As well as being our eyes and ears on the ground you’ll be looking to pro-actively seek potential issues before they arise, make clients and guests welcome in the space and ensure a positive community atmosphere. 

You'll have a background as a GM or assistant GM at a co-working space, member's club, gym concept or independent hotel. 

Responsibilities 

+ Manage all building operations and communicate with building managers where necessary to ensure highest level of member satisfaction
+ Be on hand to solve member-related issues to ensure a cohesive community and manage member expectations
+ Ensure that events run smoothly from a logistics point of view with support from a community manager.
+ Design and implement rules, guidelines and best practices for the community to optimise member experience
+ Resolve member complaints regarding other members through neutral fact + + investigation and process termination of membership when warranted
+ Be a friendly face when welcoming guests to the space 
+ Submit recommendations for any repairs, maintenance, or updates required in space
+ Identify areas which may impact member happiness i.e. insufficient cleaning staff, repeated IT-related failures, malfunctioning conference room equipment, etc.
+ Forecast revenues for future months
+ Supervise move ins and move outs to ensure seamless, easy experience for all 
+ Effectively manage communication and movement of members in cases of emergency 
+ Manage a team of office / community managers on day-to-day basis, ensuring that KPIs are met
+ Oversee all operations in the space and be ready to launch new locations

What we’re looking for in you:

+ Strong communications skills
+ Proven managerial abilities
+ Proactive 
+ Exceptional organisational and multitasking skills
+ Understanding of and experience in building or working within communities
+ Previous Office Manager experience 

Remuneration:

£30,000-£35,000 based on experience
Opportunity to manage new client spaces and expand with the company

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer
jobs.description:
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

A Full-Stack developer to work on various projects, in a full-time capacity, capable of understanding/designing the architecture of a product, developing, optimising and maintaining it.

WORK

We are scaling multiple projects - initially focused on 1) API integration, 2) full-stack development and 3) system architecture.


YOUR EXPERTISE

ReactJS
Nodejs
Javascript
MongoDB
Python

Would be an advantage:
Docker/Kubernetes
Linux knowledge
System architecture
Flask


YOUR COMPETENCIES

Problem-solving: You’re able to understand the product vision, and articulate solutions or workarounds (such as suggesting new timeframes, alternative features etc.)

Intelligence: You learn quickly. You demonstrate an ability to quickly and proficiently understand and absorb new information.

Attention to detail: You never let important details slip through the cracks or derail a project. You accurately identify what constitutes important details.

Persistence: You demonstrate tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done.

Follow-through on commitments: You live up to verbal and written agreements.

Honesty and integrity: You do not cut corners ethically. You earn trust and maintain confidences. You do what is right, and speak plainly and truthfully.

Passionate about startups: Helping innovators to grow their ideas excites you.

jobs.title: Architect / Mechanical Engineer
jobs.description:
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

An experienced and talented architect to join our growing team, in the development of a disruptive modular offices product to be be used in Commercial Real Estate. Pilots with CRE landlords and large corporate partners are already lined up and we are looking for support to deliver on our roadmap.



YOUR EXPERTISE

In-depth knowledge of Sketch up, AutoCAD, Revit and 3DS Max

Photoshop and InDesign skills (preferable)

Experience of designing Modular structures

Structural Engineering or MEP Engineering Experience is a bonus

Moderate understanding of planning and UK building regulations

Excellent design and spatial planning skills

Strong understanding of detailing and delivery of tender packages (preferable)


YOUR COMPETENCIES

- Problem solving: You’re able to understand the product vision, and articulate solutions or workarounds (such as suggesting new timeframes, alternative features etc.)

- Intelligence: You learn quickly. You demonstrate an ability to quickly and proficiently understand and absorb new information.

- Attention to detail: You never let important details slip through the cracks or derail a project. You accurately identify what constitutes important details.

- Persistence: You demonstrate tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done.

- Follow-through on commitments: You live up to verbal and written agreements.

- Honesty and integrity: You do not cut corners ethically. You earn trust and maintain confidences. You do what is right, and speak plainly and truthfully.

- Passionate about startups: Helping innovators to grow their ideas excites you.

- Experience of interior projects will also be deemed favourable

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Confident communicator, able to liaise with clients and project consultants

Exciting project with opportunity to grow at a revenue generating startup.

We are considering part-time, full -time, freelance applicants.

--------

Equity and Generous Bonuses.

To start immediately.
